spark:
Title: Technological innovations that we will see in 2021 - 15 min
Description: Artificial intelligence, virtual and augmented reality, the Internet of Things, robotics, automation... For almost five years, reviews of future technologies have been starting...
Original Language: Lithuanian

motivation.introduction: As we dive into the era of technological advancements, it's fascinating to consider how these innovations have evolved over the years. By gathering data on the development and adoption rates of artificial intelligence, virtual reality, and the Internet of Things, we can create a vivid picture of their growth trends and future potential. This exploration will highlight which technologies are becoming integral parts of our daily lives and how rapidly they are being embraced worldwide.
motivation.title: Evolving_Tech_Trends_and_Adoption_Rates_2021

nodes.name: Economic Stability
nodes.description: The overall economic stability of a region or country.

nodes.name: Public Interest in Technology
nodes.description: The level of public interest and enthusiasm for new technological advancements.

nodes.name: Government Policy on Tech Innovation
nodes.description: Government policies supporting or regulating technological innovations.

nodes.name: Investment in Tech Research
nodes.description: Financial and resource investment in technology research and development.

nodes.name: Accessibility of Technology
nodes.description: The ease with which the general public can access and use new technologies.

nodes.name: Tech Media Coverage
nodes.description: The extent and nature of media coverage on new technologies.

nodes.name: Public Adoption of New Technologies
nodes.description: The extent to which the public adopts new technologies like AI, VR, and IoT.

nodes.name: Rate of Tech Industry Growth
nodes.description: The rate at which the technology industry is growing in a region or globally.

structure.sentence: Interestingly, the growth of the technology industry is influenced not only by how quickly new technologies like AI and VR are adopted by the public but also by the overall economic stability of a region or country.
The extent to which the public embraces new technologies is shaped by how easily they can access these technologies and the nature of media coverage they receive.
Government policies on tech innovation play a crucial role, being influenced by both the economic stability of a region and the public's interest in technology.
The financial and resource investment in technology research is not only a matter of economic stability but also depends on the government's stance towards technology innovation.
How easily the public can access and use new technologies is directly affected by the level of investment in tech research and the supportive or restrictive nature of government policies.
The way media covers technological advancements is significantly swayed by the public's interest in these new technologies.
The economic stability of a region plays a foundational role, impacting not just investment in tech research but also influencing government policies on technological innovation.
Public interest in technology not only shapes government policies but also determines how technology is portrayed in the media, further influencing public adoption.

Economic Stability.subject: the region
nounclause0: there is economic uncertainty in the area
nounclause1: there is financial stability in the area
condition0: if the economic climate is shaky
condition1: if the economic climate is steady

Public Interest in Technology.subject: people
predicate0: are not keen on tech advancements
nounclause0: people have a low interest in technology
there's little enthusiasm for tech among the public
nounclause1: people are highly interested in technology
there's a high level of tech enthusiasm among the public
condition0: if public interest in technology is low
when people are not engaged with tech advancements
condition1: if public interest in technology is high
when people are actively engaged with tech advancements

Government Policy on Tech Innovation.subject: the government
nounclause0: there are strict regulations on technology
nounclause1: there's a supportive environment for technology
subclause0: a restrictive stance on technology is taken
subclause1: a supportive stance on technology is taken

Investment in Tech Research.subject: the industry
predicate1: benefits from high investment in research
nounclause0: investment in tech research is low
funding for tech development is scarce
nounclause1: investment in tech research is high
funding for tech development is abundant
subclause0: resources for tech research are limited
financial backing for development is minimal
subclause1: resources for tech research are ample
financial backing for development is substantial
condition0: if investment in tech research is low
when funding for tech development is scarce
condition1: if investment in tech research is high
when funding for tech development is abundant

Accessibility of Technology.subject: technology
predicate0: remains hard to use for many
predicate1: can be used easily by most
nounclause0: using tech is challenging for the public
nounclause1: using tech is straightforward for the public
condition0: when technology is not easily accessible
if public access to tech is limited
condition1: if public access to tech is widespread

Tech Media Coverage.subject: the media
nounclause0: tech news is not widely reported
subclause0: limited reporting on technology is seen
subclause1: extensive reporting on technology is seen
condition0: when tech media coverage is limited
if technology is not widely reported
condition1: when tech media coverage is extensive
action0: media coverage of technology is reduced
action1: media coverage of technology is increased

descriptor: adoption of new technologies by the public
Public Adoption of New Technologies.subject: the public
predicate0: is slow to adopt new technologies
shows little uptake of tech innovations
nounclause0: new technologies are not widely adopted by the public
there is low engagement with tech innovations
nounclause1: new technologies are widely adopted by the public
there is high engagement with tech innovations
subclause0: public adoption of new tech is low
uptake of tech innovations among the public is minimal
subclause1: public adoption of new tech is high
uptake of tech innovations among the public is widespread
condition0: if the public is slow to adopt new technologies
when there's little public engagement with tech
condition1: if the public quickly adopts new technologies
when there's high public engagement with tech
action0: public adoption of new technologies decreases
action1: public adoption of new technologies increases

descriptor: growth rate of the tech industry
Rate of Tech Industry Growth.subject: the tech industry
nounclause0: the tech industry's growth is slow
there's a sluggish pace of expansion in tech
nounclause1: the tech industry's growth is rapid
there's a fast pace of expansion in tech
subclause0: slow growth is seen in the tech sector
the expansion pace in tech is sluggish
subclause1: rapid growth is seen in the tech sector
the expansion pace in tech is fast
condition0: when the tech industry grows slowly
if the expansion pace in tech is sluggish
condition1: when the tech industry grows rapidly
if the expansion pace in tech is fast
action0: the growth rate of the tech industry slows down
expansion in the tech sector becomes sluggish
action1: the growth rate of the tech industry speeds up
expansion in the tech sector becomes rapid

questions.question: Does supportive government policy on tech innovation have a positive impact on the adoption of new technologies?
questions.claim: Supportive government policies on tech innovation positively influence the adoption of new technologies.

questions.question: Does a decrease in investment in tech research negatively affect the adoption of new technologies?
questions.claim: A decrease in investment in tech research leads to a negative impact on the adoption of new technologies.

questions.question: Is the impact of investment in tech research on new technology adoption greater than that of government policy on tech innovation?
questions.claim: Investment in tech research has a greater impact on new technology adoption than government policy on tech innovation.

questions.question: Is the absolute impact of government policy on tech innovation on new technology adoption greater than that of investment in tech research?
questions.claim: The absolute impact of government policy on tech innovation on new technology adoption is greater than that of investment in tech research.

questions.question: In an unstable economy, does supportive government policy on tech innovation negatively influence the adoption of new technologies?
questions.claim: In an unstable economy, supportive government policy on tech innovation has a negative influence on the adoption of new technologies.

questions.question: In an unstable economy, does increased investment in tech research positively influence the adoption of new technologies?
questions.claim: In an unstable economy, increased investment in tech research positively influences the adoption of new technologies.

questions.question: In an unstable economy, is the positive impact of investment in tech research on new technology adoption greater than that of supportive government policy?
questions.claim: In an unstable economy, investment in tech research has a greater positive impact on new technology adoption than supportive government policy.

questions.question: In an unstable economy, is the absolute impact of investment in tech research on new technology adoption less than that of government policy on tech innovation?
questions.claim: In an unstable economy, the absolute impact of investment in tech research on new technology adoption is less than that of government policy on tech innovation.

questions.question: In a stable economy, does supportive government policy on tech innovation negatively influence the adoption of new technologies?
questions.claim: In a stable economy, supportive government policy on tech innovation negatively influences the adoption of new technologies.

questions.question: In a stable economy, does increased investment in tech research positively influence the adoption of new technologies?
questions.claim: In a stable economy, increased investment in tech research positively influences the adoption of new technologies.

questions.question: In a stable economy, is the positive impact of investment in tech research on new technology adoption greater than that of supportive government policy?
questions.claim: In a stable economy, investment in tech research has a greater positive impact on new technology adoption than supportive government policy.

questions.question: In a stable economy, is the absolute impact of investment in tech research on new technology adoption greater than that of government policy on tech innovation?
questions.claim: In a stable economy, the absolute impact of investment in tech research on new technology adoption is greater than that of government policy on tech innovation.

questions.question: Is the influence of government policy on tech innovation on new technology adoption stronger in a stable economy than in an unstable one?
questions.claim: Government policy on tech innovation has a stronger influence on new technology adoption in a stable economy compared to an unstable one.

questions.question: Is the absolute influence of government policy on tech innovation on new technology adoption greater in a stable economy than in an unstable one?
questions.claim: The absolute influence of government policy on tech innovation on new technology adoption is greater in a stable economy than in an unstable one.

questions.question: Is the influence of investment in tech research on new technology adoption weaker in a stable economy than in an unstable one?
questions.claim: Investment in tech research has a weaker influence on new technology adoption in a stable economy compared to an unstable one.

questions.question: In an unstable economy, is the absolute impact of investment in tech research on new technology adoption greater than in a stable economy?
questions.claim: The absolute impact of investment in tech research on new technology adoption is greater in an unstable economy than in a stable one.

questions.question: With low public interest in technology, does supportive government policy on tech innovation negatively affect the adoption of new technologies?
questions.claim: When public interest in technology is low, supportive government policy on tech innovation negatively affects the adoption of new technologies.

questions.question: With low public interest in technology, does increased investment in tech research negatively influence the adoption of new technologies?
questions.claim: When public interest in technology is low, increased investment in tech research negatively influences the adoption of new technologies.

questions.question: With low public interest in technology, is the impact of investment in tech research on new technology adoption greater than that of government policy?
questions.claim: With low public interest in technology, investment in tech research has a greater impact on new technology adoption than government policy.

questions.question: With low public interest in technology, is the absolute impact of government policy on tech innovation less than that of investment in tech research?
questions.claim: With low public interest in technology, the absolute impact of government policy on tech innovation is less than that of investment in tech research.

questions.question: With high public interest in technology, does supportive government policy on tech innovation positively affect the adoption of new technologies?
questions.claim: When public interest in technology is high, supportive government policy on tech innovation positively affects the adoption of new technologies.

questions.question: With high public interest in technology, does increased investment in tech research negatively influence the adoption of new technologies?
questions.claim: When public interest in technology is high, increased investment in tech research negatively influences the adoption of new technologies.

questions.claim: With high public interest in technology, investment in tech research has a greater impact on new technology adoption than government policy.

questions.question: With high public interest in technology, is the absolute impact of government policy on tech innovation less than that of investment in tech research?
questions.claim: With high public interest in technology, the absolute impact of government policy on tech innovation is less than that of investment in tech research.

questions.question: Is the influence of government policy on tech innovation on new technology adoption stronger when public interest in technology is high compared to when it's low?
questions.claim: Government policy on tech innovation has a stronger influence on new technology adoption when public interest in technology is high compared to when it's low.

questions.question: With high public interest in technology, is the absolute influence of government policy on tech innovation on new technology adoption greater than with low public interest?
questions.claim: The absolute influence of government policy on tech innovation on new technology adoption is greater when public interest in technology is high compared to when it's low.

questions.question: Is the impact of investment in tech research on new technology adoption greater when public interest in technology is high compared to when it's low?
